meanings.definition: A photograph taken with a bolograph.
meanings.sent1: The bolograph showed a clear image of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: She kept the bolograph of her family on the mantel.
meanings.sent3: The bolograph of the cat wearing sunglasses made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His bolograph of the city skyline was like a window into another world.
meanings.sent5: The bolograph captured the essence of the sunset perfectly.

meanings.definition: To capture an image using a bolograph.
meanings.sent1: He decided to bolograph the rare bird in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She bolographed the flowers in the garden beautifully.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bolograph a squirrel proved to be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The artist bolographed the chaos of the city streets with precision.
meanings.sent5: To bolograph the moment, he had to be quick and steady.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a bolograph.
meanings.sent1: The bolography required careful adjustment of the lens.
meanings.sent2: She learned the bolography techniques from her mentor.
meanings.sent3: The bolography workshop was full of aspiring photographers.
meanings.sent4: The bolography process was both technical and artistic.
meanings.sent5: Mastering bolography takes practice and patience.
